io module

Module to manage general information like path to data

class darclight.io.FileList(files=None)[source]

Bases: object

Class for handling files that are grouped together in one list

append(file)[source]

Adds the given file to the filelist

Parameters:

file (str) – path to the file that should be added

Return type:

None

data(return_fname=False)[source]

Iterator that yields one data array at the time for each file in the list

Parameters:

return_fname (bool, optional) – whether or not the filename should be returned along with the data, defaults to False

Yield:

Data (and filename) of the current file

Return type:

Iterator[np.ndarray|Tuple[np.nparray,str]]

headers(return_fname=False)[source]

Iterator that yields one header array at the time for each file in the list

Parameters:

return_fname (bool, optional) – whether or not the filename should be returned along with the header, defaults to False

Yield:

Header (and filename) of the current file

Return type:

Iterator[np.ndarray|Tuple[np.nparray,str]]

class darclight.io.Observation(raw_path=None, reduced_path=None)[source]

Bases: object

Class that organizes the individual imagetypes and data paths

property dark_exposures: list[int]

Exposure values where a darkframe is directly available.

Returns:

list of exposure values

Return type:

list[int]

static files_from_header(path)[source]

detects the individual images and sorts them according to their header

Parameters:

path (Path) – the path where the files are located

Returns:

a FileList object for every found type. Dark frames are sorted in a dictionary with their exposure as key, Flats are sorted into a dictionary according to the used filter and the light frames according to the object.

Return type:

Tuple[FileList,dict[int,FileList],dict[str,FileList],dict[str,FileList]]

static hdu_from_file(file)[source]

gives access to the data and header of a given file

Parameters:

file (str) – name of the file

Returns:

the data and header from that file

Return type:

Tuple[np.ndarray,astropy.io.fits.header.Header]

master_exists(frame, used_filter=None)[source]

checks if a masterframe is registered or if it exists in the reduced data directory.

Parameters:

  • frame (str) – type of frame for which the check sould be performed. Available options are ‘bias’, ‘dark’, ‘flat’ and ‘light’

  • used_filter (str, optional) – for which filter the check should be performed, has to be the same string as in the header, defaults to None

Returns:

True if a master exists, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

static safe_file(filename, data, header=None)[source]

Saves the given data and header with the given filename in the reduced data directory.

Parameters:

  • filename (str) – Desired name for the file

  • data (np.ndarray) – data that should be stored in the file

  • header (astropy.io.fits.header.Header, optional) – header for the file, defaults to None

Return type:

None

property used_filters: list[str]

Return filters where a flat frame is available.

Returns:

list of filters

Return type:

list[str]
